import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"List filter categories"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/categories/of/filters"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Returns the catalog of filter categories that organize available search facets. These categories mirror the groupings shown in the IncidentIQ UI (for example, Asset filters, General, and Timeline filters). Use this endpoint before retrieving individual facets to understand how filters are grouped.

**Workflow Example**
1. Call [GET /api/v1.0/categories/of/filters](/docs/api/categories/list-filter-categories) to fetch the filter taxonomy.
2. Use returned CategoryId values to scope searches or build custom filter UIs that align with system-defined groupings.

**Minimal Required Fields**: none (ParentCategoryId is optional for drilling into sub-categories).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"ProductFilterType","in":"query","schema":{"type":"string","enum":["all","current"],"default":"current"},"description":"Filter by product scope"},{"name":"ParentCategoryId","in":"query","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"description":"Filter to children of a specific parent category"},{"name":"ApplySiteVisibility","in":"query","schema":{"type":"boolean","default":true},"description":"Whether to apply site-level visibility rules"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
